Class SocketConnection

java.lang.Object
networking.SocketConnection
Direct Known Subclasses:
ClientHandler
public abstract class SocketConnection extends Object
Wrapper for a TCP socket connection. Handles sending and receiving single-line messages over the network. This class is not thread-safe.

  • Constructor Details

    • SocketConnection

      protected SocketConnection(Socket socket) throws IOException
      Creates a new socket connection using an existing socket.
      Parameters:
      socket - the socket to wrap
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input or output streams cannot be created

    • SocketConnection

      protected SocketConnection(InetAddress host, int port) throws IOException
      Creates a new TCP connection to the given host and port. The receiving thread is not started automatically.
      Parameters:
      host - the server address
      port - the server port
      Throws:
      IOException - if the connection cannot be established

    • SocketConnection

      protected SocketConnection(String host, int port) throws IOException
      Creates a new TCP connection to the given host and port. The receiving thread is not started automatically.
      Parameters:
      host - the server hostname
      port - the server port
      Throws:
      IOException - if the connection cannot be established

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the receiving thread. This method may only be called once.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if called more than once

    • receivePackets

      public void receivePackets()
      Continuously receives messages from the socket. For each received line, handlePackets(String) is invoked. When the connection closes, handleDisconnect() is called.

    • sendPacket

      public boolean sendPacket(String message)
      Sends a single-line message to the remote endpoint.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to send (must not contain newlines)
      Returns:
      true if the message was sent successfully, false otherwise

    • close

      public void close()
      Closes the socket connection. This will also stop the receiving thread.

    • handleStart

      protected void handleStart()
      Called once when the receiving thread starts. Subclasses may override this method.

    • handlePackets

      protected abstract void handlePackets(String message)
      Handles a single received message.
      Parameters:
      message - the received message

    • handleDisconnect

      public abstract void handleDisconnect()
      Called when the connection is closed.
